description: Write n as a sum of terms of the form (p^2-1)/24 where p is a prime > 4; sequence gives those n which require at least 4 terms.
comments: Chowla conjectures that all numbers are the sum of no more than four terms of the form (p^2-1)/24 where p is a prime > 4.
references: R. K. Guy, Unsolved Problems In Number Theory, section C20.
author: _Jud McCranie_, Jun 20 2000
